page.title: 10TRADES
page.content: On Wednesday my mum goes to Mann's in Torquay which is a wholeseller. They sell fruit and veg and she buys some things from there and grows the rest in our garden. In the afternoon she packs the fruit and veg in the car. On Thursday morning she goes to Staverton market near Totnes and she sells it there. Other people do the same thing, they grow flowers, vegetables and fruit and sell them in the local markets, particularly Newton Abbot. At Rocombe, Stokeinteignhead, Mr Maurice Hunt grows anemones. He is now known world wide. He dislikes using insecticides and pays children to collect ladybirds (5p each) for his greenhouses. Trades surviving and active include thatching, cider making, building but there is no longer a farrier or blacksmith.
